panels.description: Partition utilization, disk read, disk write, download bandwidth, upload bandwidth, if there are multiple network cards or multiple partitions, it is the value of the network card or partition with the highest utilization rate collected.

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to the resource details

panels.title: Server resource overview table (10 lines per page)
$job：Overall total load and overall average CPU usage
$job: overall total memory and overall average memory usage
$job：Overall total disk and overall average disk usage

panels.description:
In this kanban: the total disk, usage, available, and usage rate are consistent with the values of the Size, Used, Avail, and Use% columns of the df command, and the value of Use% will be rounded to one decimal place, which will be more accurate . 

Note: The Use% algorithm in df is: (size-free) * 100 / (avail + (size-free)), the result is divisible by this value, non-divisible by +1, and the result The unit is %. 
Reference df command source code:
panels.title: $show_hostname：Free space in each partition

panels.description:
Read bytes Number of bits read per second per disk partition
Written bytes Number of bits written per second per disk partition
panels.title: Disk read and write capacity per second

panels.description:
Reads completed: Number of reads completed per second per disk partition

Writes completed: Number of writes completed per second per disk partition

IO now Number of input/output requests being processed per second per disk partition
panels.title: Disk read and write rate (IOPS)

panels.description:
Every second of natural time, the time spent on I/O. (Wall-clock time)

node_disk_io_time_seconds_total:
Number of seconds the disk spends on input/output operations. This value is the cumulative value. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]):
Calculate the rate per second: (last value-last previous value)/timestamp difference, that is: disk cost in 1 second The proportion of time spent on I/O operations.
panels.title: Percentage of time spent on I/O operations per 1 second

panels.description:
Read time seconds Number of seconds spent in read operations per disk partition

Write time seconds Number of seconds spent in write operations per disk partition

IO time seconds Number of seconds spent in input/output operations per disk partition

IO time weighted seconds The weighted seconds spent on input/output operations of each disk partition
panels.title: Time spent for each IO read and write (reference: less than 100ms) (beta)

panels.description:
Sockets_used-Total amount of all protocol sockets used

CurrEstab-TCP connections with current status of ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT

TCP_alloc-TCP sockets allocated (established, applied to sk_buff) Quantity

TCP_tw-Number of TCP connections waiting to be closed

UDP_inuse-Number of UDP sockets in use

RetransSegs-Number of TCP retransmitted packets

OutSegs-Number of TCP sent packets

InSegs-Number of packets received by TCP
panels.title: Network socket connection information

yaxes.label: Total amount of all protocol sockets used

targets.legendFormat: Number of context switches per second

panels.title: Open file descriptor (left) / number of context switches per second (right)
